bug.author: andrashee
bug.summary: Missing code file when using jupyter-lab
bug.description:
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.8 Python version: 3.7 Operating System: docker, ubuntu, jupyter-lab
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
When using the attached notebook I get the following error: <denchmark-code>FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/app/notebooks/wandb/run-20190815_122626-y9w00bpa/code/notebooks/wandb.ipynb' </denchmark-code>
When looking into the /app/notebooks/wandb/run-20190815_122626-y9w00bpa/code/ directory, one can see that the file is indeed missing. It seems that wandb couldn't copy the current notebook file into the wandb directory. Is there an error how I'm using wandb or is this a bug? <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
See notebook: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/files/3505559/wandb.ipynb.txt>wandb.ipynb</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.69. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
This definitely looks like a bug. A quick fix would be to run os.environ['WANDB_NOTEBOOK_NAME']="wandb.ipynb" before calling wandb.init, I'll look into the root cause.

I have a fix for this coming out in 0.8.9. You can install the cli from master to use the fix now, you don't need to specify the notebook name: pip install --upgrade git+git://github.com/wandb/client.git@master#egg=wandb
Many thanks for the quick fix. Works now like a charm üíØ
0.8.9 was released today which has the fix!
